contest-event.event-date:
June 21, 1975 D West of England Bandsmen's Festival (Class A)
West of England Bandsmen's Festival (Class A) 500 Test Piece Contest West of England Bandsmen's Festival (Bugle) west-of-england-bandsmen-s-festival-class-a
None
Diadem of Gold
Molinnis Park, Bugle, Cornwall, England, UK WEBF website lists Bude rather than Bugle, but H. Camps was the Bugle conductor at this time, and Bugle seems a more likely band to have been entered in Class A at this time.
'Hymn to Music' - Dudley Buck: 1 St. Dennis, 90 2 St. Austell, 89 3 Soundwell, 88 4 Camborne, 86 5 Mount Charles, 84 6 Bugle, 83
Best Player: 1 Jim Bell, Soundwell 2 Peter Minear, St. Dennis 3 Cliff Sayers, Soundwell
Best Set of Basses St. Austell Best Solo Horn Robert Cook - Camborne A. R. Trudgian Youth Awards Pat Hobba Phillip Penglaze
Deportment (Class D, judge WO A. B. Sparkes): 1 Camborne 2 Bideford (Class C)
May 14, 2013, 6:51 a.m. May 12, 2014, 7:55 a.m.
1 Soundwell Arthur Kenney
2 St. Dennis Band Eddie Williams
3 Camborne Town Band Bernard Bygrave
4 St. Austell Town Band Fred Roberts
5 Mount Charles Brass Band William Maginn
6 Bugle Silver Band Hugh Camps
Unknown Result Yorkley Onward Band Brian Howard
